page.title: 11OLD BUILDINGS RESTORED
page.content: {High Street's Ancient Priors,}built in the C15th, was renovated in 1924. Timbers and roof were cleaned and replaced. Now a restaurant, it has kept its frontage. {The George, also {in High Street,}was a house in 1400, then a coaching inn where horses were changed. It has a rare gallows inn- sign. But, built of timber, plaster and tiles, it is now much changed. The {Punch Bowle}is one of the oldest intact buildings in Crawley, a classic Wealden jettied C15th house, once a teashop for motorists but now a bank. Restoration revealing original features has made it attractive. Volunteer restoration of{Ifield Water- {mill}began in 1974 with research by schools, and public donations. Work continues to repair machinery. C13th {Ifield Barn}is now a theatre, rebuilt 1968-73 at a cost of Â£26000.
